Prost to Germany, German beer and German food!

Biergarten is exactly what I have been searching for and I need to make sure that I come here more often. Located in the heart of Hayes Valley, this beautiful industrial-inspired beer garden, is certainly a go-to spot for beer lovers looking to enjoy one of the few outdoor patios that San Francisco has to offer.

The menu includes all your classic German wants (nay, needs), including pretzels, curry wurst pickles and more! For beer, you have anything from a light blonde, to a dark amber. They've got stiegl, franziskaner, schneiderweisse and even radler (beer/sprite mix). And don't worry, if the German food and German beer isn't enough German for you, you can always order your drink in a classic (and massive) German beer mug. 

The garden has plenty of seating, so don't worry about that. However, the place is serve yourself, so you might need to wait in line to order. If it's a beautiful day and you want to get outside, I highly suggest coming to Biergarten for at least a pint or two.

excerpts: I recommend ordering the Weihenstephaner Original Lager, Bratwurst and the Pork Belly sliders.
weihenstephaner original lager.author: Shannon R.
weihenstephaner original lager.review:
Great place with an energetic atmosphere. Be sure to get there early so a friend can snag a communal table while you wait in line to get your (liter of) beer. Also have everyone's ID in your hand when you go get drinks; it's required. All the beers are yummy and the food is to die for. I recommend ordering the Weihenstephaner Original Lager, Bratwurst and the Pork Belly sliders.

Biergarten also has a sister restaurant called Suppenküche that you should go check out!

excerpts: A half liter will cost you $8-10 (Schneider Weisse is $9 and their Edel-Weisse is $10), and a full liter costs double - so no cost savings for ordering the liter.
Besides the prices, the other thing that is very un-Bavarian is the line.
Germans hate lines and they really hate having to wait for their beer.
At Biergarten on a sunny Sunday afternoon we waited 27 minutes to order because well, San Franciscans love lines.
However the SF touch that I do appreciate is the blankets for when it inevitably gets cold and windy.
All in all, Biergarten is a very smartly executed concept which is why we continue to return.

schneider weisse.review:

However, I really loved it!  They were completely out of food, which is a huge pet peeve of mine when going out, but we had no problem getting beer.  You can choose between a liter and a half liter.  Plus, If you come at night, there is a much shorter line, and there are wool blankets to keep you warm.

The selection isn't massive, but what they are serving is delicious.  I had the Schneider Weisse, and it was my favorite beer ever.  It had hints of banana and some spices, and I would totally recommend it.  It's a darker color, but it does not taste like it at all.  I tried sips of two other things as well that were good, but I have no idea what they were.  

What really warmed my heat over was that they have Almdudler.  I spent an entire summer in Austria and drank SO MUCH Almdudler.  While it's a bit more expensive than the home country, it was nice to see some non-alcoholic beverages with the German theme as well.

I've taken every person that's visited me to this beer garden, shared seeded pretzels, pickles, and the occasional pretzel-wich, and had many great afternoons here.  It's a shame this place closes so early (especially on Sundays), but it's completely understandable based on the neighborhood and outdoor location.  Make sure to dress warmly, and keep an eye out for the friendly staff that come by with cozy blankets at night!

schneider weisse.author: Brett L.
schneider weisse.review:
It really pains me to give this rating, but my girlfriend and I both got sick after eating here. We had an order of pickles and a pretzel while waiting in line, and later the sausages and sauerkraut. I'm guessing it was the latter that did us in. This is such a shame, because the food was surprisingly good. Fortunately, it was not too bad, and neither of us missed work.

Had it not been for the incident with the food, I'd give this place 3.5 stars, maybe 4. The biggest problem is the lines. I don't mind waiting to get into the place (the guy at the door (the owner?) was really friendly and helpful), but you have to go back into that long line to order another beer, as there is no table service nor a separate line for customers already inside. I'd also deduct a 1/2 star for lack of variety. They had Schneider Weisse (yay!), but the other two beers were ok. The Radler is way too sweet for me, but that's a personal preference I suppose. Those were the only options the day we were there.

So my take on this place? If you don't mind the lines, this is a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. The communal outdoor benches are great. I'll personally avoid the food, but might be back for a beer. With Schmidt's and Walzwerk not far away, however, I might just go to one of those places to get a better selection of beer.

radler.review:
3 stars for the great location and for being one of the remarkably few beer gardens in the city.

Minus points because I don't really like the beer selection. Now I'm not a beer expert, but I do have a fully stocked beer fridge in my bedroom so that definitely puts me in  the category of "Someone who drinks a lot of beer" (and a lazy ass, but that's besides the point). The best beers at Biergarten are definitely the darker ones (IPA, amber ale, Oktoberfest, etc.), but on a HOT ass day when I want to be outdoors, I don't want a fucking IPA; I want something lighter and refreshing and those kind of beers here are not my cup of tea. I mean whatever, I'll finish the gargantuan stein of lager because I ain't no lil bitch, but I don't enjoy it. And for $18/Liter, I want to enjoy it.

Another time I was like maybe I'll just drink 2 L of the Radler because it'll taste better and will be the alcohol equivalent of 1 L of its base beer (Helles), but nooope. It was even worse. The added lemon soda is almost chemical tasting and I didn't even get a good buzz :(

It can also get pretty crowded, but what do you expect? Did I mention there are remarkably few beer gardens in the city? Otherwise, on an average "not too hot, not too cold, all you need is a light jacket" day, the other beers will do just fine.

radler.review:
A friend of mine tipped me off about Biergarten - it's not too far from his house in SF. As a good German girl, I had to see for myself if this was a good drinking spot or not.

The good:
- Conveniently located right off the Freeway - even if you aren't a city dweller, you can find this spot pretty easy. Simply exit at Octavia from 101 and you'll see it pretty quickly.
- Parking is easily accessible, even on the weekends.
- It's always fun drinking beer out in the sunshine.
- Very good beer selection. Not too many choices, but the ones they have on-tap are pretty good.
- Fresh baked pretzels to go with your brew. Yummy!

The not-so-great:
- As with many outdoor patios, Biergarten gets pretty crowded on a relatively warm, sunny day in San Francisco. You definitely need to be aggressive when it comes to finding a seat.
- Their Radler was disappointing. Having spent 3 weeks in Germany as an exchange student, I'm quite familiar with different varieties of lemonade/beer combos. This one wasn't good - way too sweet. Stick to the other drinks on the menu.
- Once the sun goes down, it gets pretty chilly this time of year. Bundle up and bring a blanket! You won't regret it.

Overall, a very decent drinking experience in the city. Come with a group of friends and plan on drinking some Litres. Very fun!

pretzel.review:
There was a time when I lived in Hayes Valley.  My landlord, who lived on Upper Polk, had bought a condo on Page Street and when I informed her that I'd be moving out she said "I was hoping that neighborhood would be better by now.  That was supposed to be my retirement home".  

That was in the late 1980's, when a freeway ran right through the neighborhood and hookers solicited business beneath that freeway, at least on Page Street.  That landlord may be long gone but her dream of an improved Hayes Valley has arrived.  What a change 30 years makes.
 
Though there's a million booze and food choices lining Hayes Street, Biergarten sits off Patricia's Green, hidden amongst the shipping containers offering coffee, juice, and ice cream.  Its popularity makes clear that it's no secret, but unless you're looking for it it'd be easy to miss.    

There's nothing here to go crazy over but the appeal of casual al fresco dining and drinking (especially in the heat of late) is attractive.  Having hit Berlin at the beginning of winter, when their biergartens had mostly moved indoors, Biergarten stood in as a worthy surrogate.  

I sampled only beer, a warm pretzel, and potato salad ($6) and feel confident in reporting that Biergarten will fill your gut without raiding your savings.  It inspired my partner, with his 1/2 pint beer, to look around at the full pints and offer "I'd like to come back here again" (no doubt for more beer).  

With the picnic tables pretty full my 2-person party did little to skew the average patron age at Biergarten which otherwise skews young.  Still, nobody looked askance at those of us who remember this area from a time that pre-dates their birth certificate.  Despite the crowd, Biergarten proved to be good for all ages and, though I saw a dog there I notice that their web site says "no pets".  That right there might be the worst thing about the place. 

Bier, filling German fare, and sunshine; what's not to like?

excerpts: I honestly can't think of a food item where you can go wrong, but my favorite is the egg sandwich and pretzel knots (when available).
pretzel.author: david m.
pretzel.review:
Consistently good food and revolving menu of German beers. Great for sitting in the sun and having an afternoon with friends. They even have blankets for when the fog rolls in and pop-up tents if it gets drizzly. What's not to like?

I honestly can't think of a food item where you can go wrong, but my favorite is the egg sandwich and pretzel knots (when available).

excerpts: We ordered the pretzel and it wasn't great.
pretzel.author: Taylor F.
pretzel.review:
Great outdoor space in an amazing location in Hayes Valley. I came here on a Saturday afternoon with some friends. It was pretty crowded but we were able to snag a seat at an open table right away. It is all outdoor seating and there are big picnic table so you will likely share with other people depending on bow big your group is. 

You go up the counter to order. Good beer list and they serve them in big authentic steins. We ordered the pretzel and it wasn't great. It was pretty small and was cold and hard. 

There is no indoors seating so be sure to bring a jacket because it can get chilly. They also have blankets you can use if you get cold. 

Overall it's a great spot to come with a group of friends on a sunny day. I will definitely be back.

excerpts: We had a beer and the pretzel and their cheese app.
I am not sure if I was misreading the menu or just assumed what I wanted
but I thought the cheese would be a hot dip for my warm pretzel.
I was wrong, it was cold and odd.
It had a heavy blue cheese-ish flavor and I was not a fan.
The pretzel was good, just like most bar pretzels.
It came with mustard and fresh horseradish.
I would recommend the pretzel
pretzel.author: Danielle B.
pretzel.review:
We came to this place as part of a pub crawl that a coworker put together. They are beer and wine only and are fully outdoor.  We got here around 10 pm and it was freezing, we probably would not have stayed here if we were not a part of the group as we were too cold.

We had a beer and the pretzel and their cheese app. I am not sure if I was misreading the menu or just assumed what I wanted but I thought the cheese would be a hot dip for my warm pretzel.  I was wrong, it was cold and odd. It had a heavy blue cheese-ish flavor and I was not a fan. The pretzel was good, just like most bar pretzels. It came with mustard and fresh horseradish. I would recommend the pretzel but I would not get the cheese again.

Many people with us ordered the pork sliders and seemed to enjoy them but this was our 3rd bar stop so I am not sure if they were delicious or just necessary. 

I would come back earlier in the day when the sun is shining when I want to sit on a patio,  but I do not think this is a place that I would seek out or go out of my way for.

excerpts: Throw in a pretzel into the mix!
The Wednesday burger looked so amazing that I felt compelled to get it, but surprisingly not my fav.
pretzel.author: Shannon L.
pretzel.review:
I've lived in Germany for a month before and this place really brought me back to some good times.  I'm not a huge drinker (but come on just get the big liter for the snaps) so I'll focus my review on the food, which I felt was pretty legit.  

I loved the bratwurst, especially with the potatoes.  The pork belly sliders are a must.  Throw in a pretzel into the mix!  The Wednesday burger looked so amazing that I felt compelled to get it, but surprisingly not my fav.  Just get more sliders to share!

The outdoor seating is really cute.  When it started to get chilly, a really nice lady brought out these really heavy blankets for us.

excerpts: Get the pretzel.
I would skip the deviled eggs, pork sliders, and curry worst next time and opt for trying some new things
pretzel.author: Laura D.
pretzel.review: Get the pretzel. I would skip the deviled eggs, pork sliders, and curry worst next time and opt for trying some new things

excerpts: I was so excited to try the pretzel bun since I never had it, so I ordered the frankfurter.
Only for the cashier (who looked as enthused to be working on a Friday night as I would be) to tell me they had ran out of the buns.
I said that was fine.
Except I noticed she still charged the full $8 for a frankfurter missing the bun...
Not the type to contest 45 mins before closing
so I decided to just be happy to get food.
pretzel.author: Cindy L.
pretzel.review:
Great vibes and beer selection for bar crawl beginnings; But just ok service and food

Alcohol: Pure cider rose with black currant ($7). This was very yummy as a non-beer and alcohol appreciator. My friends also got other draft beers/dark stouts and they seemed to enjoy it.

Food: I was so excited to try the pretzel bun since I never had it, so I ordered the frankfurter. Only for the cashier (who looked as enthused to be working on a Friday night as I would be) to tell me they had ran out of the buns. I said that was fine. Except I noticed she still charged the full $8 for a frankfurter missing the bun...Not the type to contest 45 mins before closing so I decided to just be happy to get food. But even the frankfurter (imagine a mushier Costco hot dog) and sauerkraut (not very pickly/crisp) were just meh. 

Service: The cashier/bartender just didn't look happy to be there or happy that anyone was there, and that just puts me off. Like people are here on a Friday night excited to try the food and the drinks. The server however was very friendly and quick to bring out the food.

Vibes: Great vibes and outdoor lighting. The people who come are the non-rowdy, let's just enjoy each other's company type which was great. No outdoor heating, so it get pretty chilly! They also close early for a bar (9pm), so definitely a starting place for a bar crawl in Hayes Valley or an ice cream outing at the Smitten next door.

excerpts: Don't get excited if you see brezel or pretzel on the menu.
We ordered one thinking it was a pretzel.
It's not the type of pretzel you would normally get from a ballpark or mall, but a small circular patty of sorts.
Wouldn't recommend ordering it based off of the taste/flavors.
I would return on a nice sunny day just for the beer.
pretzel.author: Saachi G.
pretzel.review:
A great place to grab a beer or two (OR be a champ and get a stein). Good selection of German beers available to choose from. Plenty of seating. The only downside is that it's outdoors so if you get cold easily you'll want to bring a thick warm jacket to fight off the chilly evening SF wind. They have thick blankets available for use (limited supply). 

Don't get excited if you see brezel or pretzel on the menu. We ordered one thinking it was a pretzel. It's not the type of pretzel you would normally get from a ballpark or mall, but a small circular patty of sorts. Wouldn't recommend ordering it based off of the taste/flavors. I would return on a nice sunny day just for the beer.

excerpts: I got the pretzel knot with bananas and it was amazing, but not filling and very small.
pretzel.author: Elizabeth L.
pretzel.review:
Came here after work to hang out with a friend after work! Biergarten is such a cute spot to get a beer and snacks with a small or large group on a laidback sunny day.  I love how they have light hanging over a bunch of picnic tables that are arranged in a circle.  

The beer comes by the liter which is perfect, just like in Munchen ;P They even have steins from Hofbrauhaus and other places in Germany! The food is also delicious, but they are very small in portion and size.  I got the pretzel knot with bananas and it was amazing, but not filling and very small.  I would say this is an appetizer for a bigger meal later.  

Very cute place to stop by.  Definitely recommend. 

PS if it gets cold, they even provide large wool blankets.

Atmosphere: 4/5
Food and Drink: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 4/5

excerpts: I ordered the pretzel because I wasn't incredibly hungry.
It came with some spicy mustard and horse radish.
DELISH.
SO SOFT.
I love soft pretzels.
I wanna try the other food on the menu!
pretzel.author: Amy T.
pretzel.review:
What a great place to hang out! I love Biergarten. I am a lover of all beers and delicious bar food and Biergarten delivers on both accounts. 

+ ATMOSPHERE: Outdoors, very hip, tons of picnic table style seating, twinkly string lights, and food truck-ish vibes. I've been here twice so far; once after work and once right when they opened on a Sunday. After work, it was CRAZY PACKED. Like brimming with techies and hipsters. EVERYWHERE. It's hard to find a seat. The other time, we got there right when it opened at 1 PM ish so it wasn't packed but it filled up within the hour. So definitely try to plan accordingly because it'll be hard to find seating unless you're lucky. Biergarten is very casual and a great spot to hang out with friends. It's sort of like someone's backyard hang out spot. It's chill. It's cool. I dig it.

+ BEER/FOOD: The beer is expensive (typical of SF of course). Choices are somewhat limited. But very good beers. There are half liter and full liter options. I think most of the liters were ~$20 and half liters ranged from ~$8-10 each. Tons of food on the menu though! So many German food options! I ordered the pretzel because I wasn't incredibly hungry. It came with some spicy mustard and horse radish. DELISH. SO SOFT. I love soft pretzels. I wanna try the other food on the menu! My friend ordered the Guest Knot and he thoroughly enjoyed it as well. 

+ THE FINAL VERDICT: Biergarten is a great German inspired beer garden. I'm a fan of course, but mostly for the atmosphere. I love the outdoor seating and how everything's set up. It's a perfect place to chill and hang out with friends. Very casual and laid back. The food and beer is solid. There are more choices for food than there are for beers, which is a little upsetting because I love my beer -- but I can deal because I mainly come here to hang out.

excerpts: The pretzels and pickled deviled eggs are great for sharing (although I hate having to share my pretzel).
pretzel.author: Regina L.
pretzel.review:
The Biergarten should be a home run in my books because of the great German beer, food, and outdoor space. When the sun is out (and even when it's not), you can bet that people flock to this place to sit out in the sun and drink delicious beer. Biergarten is a great use of space, as they utilize shipping containers and make an empty lot a fun place for people to congregate. Their beer list is extensive and offers something for everything. And the food, omg, I absolutely love German food, and they do not disappoint. My favorite sausages are the Bratwurst and the Currywurst; they are both authentic and filling. The pretzels and pickled deviled eggs are great for sharing (although I hate having to share my pretzel). 

The problem, you ask? That LINE. The line of all lines. In order to get a beer or order food, you have to wait in a line that snakes practically across the lot. And it's not a fast line either, especially when you're thirsty or your friends are already seated and waiting for you. I wish there was a better system for ordering; normally I would just order two drinks at a time, but the beer would quickly get warm sitting in the sun (and no one likes warm beer). So there you have it: a lively spot to meet friends, great beer and food, but the most buzzkill line ever.

excerpts: and I ordered half a liter of light lager and my friend got a liter of beer along with a side of pretzel and German sausage with potatoes.
The pretzel had a nice tingly light salty taste to it; the dough was soft and warm!
I was happy that it was freshly baked and it came with radish and mustard- definitely tasted like the pretzel I had from the Frankfurt airport I had a year ago
Good memories.
The German sausage came with a small serving of potatoes.
I thought that it would taste amazing with siracha LOL.
Coincidentally two German travelers sat next to us
and we instantly got along.
We asked if it tasted authentically and they actually told us it was really good!!
I'd say this beer garden attracts the right crowd- friendly, fun, and adventurous people.
The table behind me was definitely enjoying their time due to the sudden increase in volume and laughter!
pretzel.author: Debby L.
pretzel.review:
Ocktoberfest is in the air!!! My friend chose this this morning and I love German beer gardens so I had to agree! We met at 3pm just 2 hours after they opened and it was already packed! The line wasn't too long maybe like a 5 minute wait and I ordered half a liter of light lager and my friend got a liter of beer along with a side of pretzel and German sausage with potatoes. The pretzel had a nice tingly light salty taste to it; the dough was soft and warm! I was happy that it was freshly baked and it came with radish and mustard- definitely tasted like the pretzel I had from the Frankfurt airport I had a year ago :) Good memories. The German sausage came with a small serving of potatoes. I thought that it would taste amazing with siracha LOL. Coincidentally two German travelers sat next to us and we instantly got along. We asked if it tasted authentically and they actually told us it was really good!! I'd say this beer garden attracts the right crowd- friendly, fun, and adventurous people. The table behind me was definitely enjoying their time due to the sudden increase in volume and laughter! Being here made me want to return to Germany in the winter and I am definitely going to put this thought into consideration since Christmas markets originated from Munich, Germany  


To new visitors or tourists: I highly recommend uberring or bussing here because parking is scarce.

excerpts: Order a pretzel and lemonade soda!
pretzel.author: Leo V.
pretzel.review:
Dear Yelp,

Be careful what you order. Food is delicious but if you're not careful they might give you more food than you intended to order. Check your receipt before paying. Order a pretzel and lemonade soda!

excerpts: For food, we got the soft pretzel, currywurst, and pickled things.
Overall, all of them were typical bar food, and mostly tasted good in tandem with the beer.
I would definitely come back in the future!
pretzel.author: Monica S.
pretzel.review:
Wonderful outdoor seating, and awesomely large liter beers. My boyfriend, his brother, and I visited this place when we were in SF for our usual foodie trips. We waited out in the line before the place even opened, so we got in, ordered, and got seated fairly quickly. I would definitely say this place is not cheap, especially with all that beer - a liter comes out to about $18. 

For food, we got the soft pretzel, currywurst, and pickled things. Overall, all of them were typical bar food, and mostly tasted good in tandem with the beer. I would definitely come back in the future!

excerpts: Just came here with two of my friends and we just had some Aldersbacher draft beer and a pretzel that came with mustard and horse radish.
The employees are super nice too!
pretzel.author: Cassandra K.
pretzel.review: Fun spot to hang out during the day! Just came here with two of my friends and we just had some Aldersbacher draft beer and a pretzel that came with mustard and horse radish. The employees are super nice too! :)

excerpts:
Then your pretzel comes out and you eat it so fast, you look around to decide who'd want to perform the Heimlich Maneuver when the inevitable choking will happen.
You don't choke and you're still alive. 
But now you're so thirsty from all the salt you chug another third of your beer. 
You feel OK.
You look around and have an epiphany over whether this is what life is all about.
You decide that it is and you attempt to drink the last third of your beer.
pretzel.author: Lanie L.
pretzel.review:
"Oh look! A long line! It must be good! Should we stand in it?"

The answer is an enthusiastic 'Yes!'

There are many lines you can stand in here in this great city. But if you're a true San Franciscan and really want to stand in line, Biergarten is for you!

You get to stand in line for 40 minutes while you start to suffer from dehydration.
You order 1 Liter of beer because you convince yourself you're that thirsty and you can drink it all.
You chug a third of it and feel better. In fact, you feel GREAT.
Then your pretzel comes out and you eat it so fast, you look around to decide who'd want to perform the Heimlich Maneuver when the inevitable choking will happen.
You don't choke and you're still alive. But now you're so thirsty from all the salt you chug another third of your beer. You feel OK.
You look around and have an epiphany over whether this is what life is all about.
You decide that it is and you attempt to drink the last third of your beer.
You almost throw up.

Your friends are convinced that you did throw up.

Whatever. They don't understand. They drag out out and take you home.

You feel great.

excerpts: Pretzel wasn't that great, but pickled devil eggs were amazing.
pretzel.author: Susy C.
pretzel.review:
It's a decent spot to hang out when the weather permits. When it doesn't and Karl is out in full force, they give out blankets. Although I wouldn't really want to use them because let's be real here, how often do they wash them? 

Decently priced beers. Pretzel wasn't that great, but pickled devil eggs were amazing. 

Sometimes there's a long arse line to get in. When that's the case it's not really worth waiting. 

The crowd seems fairly mixed, although there's an occasional genius who will bring their toddler in with them and give me evil side eye just because I dropped an F bomb. Seriously, who the heck brings kids into bars? Stop doing that. Hayes Valley people, I swear.

excerpts: They also have some snacks, such as pretzels, pretzel knots, deviled eggs.
pretzel.author: Tanay J.
pretzel.review:
One of my favourite places in Hayes Valley especially when it's not too cold outside.

They have half litre and 1 litre jugs of beers, for $8-9 and $15-16 respectively. The selection of beers is quite good.

The place has large picnic-style benches. If you go on warm evenings it can get pretty crowded, but usually you should be able to find a spot.

They also have some snacks, such as pretzels, pretzel knots, deviled eggs. I thought the pretzels were fantastic! 

I love the place overall, though wish they had heating lamps - that would make it an all-year around spot for me, as opposed to just a summer spot.

excerpts: What goes better with a giant beer than a giant pretzel?
Or, really good, pickled deviled eggs?
pretzel.author: Catie F.
pretzel.review:
A pretty darn perfect place to hang out with friends - or just the people nearby - on any given "nice" day (or night). 

The beer - giant. I'd like more of a variety, but admittedly I'm a girly beer drinker. Still, there's something so satisfying about drinking out of a beer stein the size of your head, with some good heft to it.

The snacks - exactly right. What goes better with a giant beer than a giant pretzel? Or, really good, pickled deviled eggs? #recommended 

The atmosphere - picnic tables, string lighting, the heart of Hayes Valley. Worth spending some time.

excerpts: + We got pork belly sliders, deviled eggs, and a pretzel.
They were all fairly delicious.
pretzel.author: Kaje Y.
pretzel.review:
Biked here with a friend one day, and was ready for some food and drinks. 

We got in line, which wasn't very long. Just enough time to decide on some food and drinks. 

+ They have one of my favourite beers on tap! Schineider Nelson Sauvin. It's an amazing beer with a nice floral-esque nose AND flavour to it. I ended up getting two of these.
+ The food was decent. Better than average, but not amazing. The prices were reasonable, not that expensive, and accurately reflected the value food. 
++ We got pork belly sliders, deviled eggs, and a pretzel. They were all fairly delicious. The deviled eggs are pink!

When we went up for round two of beers, the queue was fairly long and it was quite a wait. Seating is definitely hard. They have plenty of seats, but this place gets packed and popular!

I cannot comment on parking because I biked. 
There is no real "service" happening here. You buy your beer and then you sit down. Food is brought to you, and your tables bused. Very little interaction, so we'll keep that neutral. It's actually better that way so you can quality time talking with friends without being interrupted. 

Good beers, decent food, reasonable prices. Will return when they come back from vacation, and I recommend this place!

excerpts: I ended up getting the pretzel and pork belly sliders.
The pretzel was okay.
It was cold by the time I got it, so it wasn't amazing.
I also didn't get a beer (since I don't really like beer) with it so probably didn't have the full experience with the pretzel I was supposed to.
The pork belly sliders, on the other hand, were amazing.
pretzel.author: Nina Y.
pretzel.review:
Had a friend come up into the city with her cousin and wanted to grab dinner elsewhere, but it was packed, so we walked around Hayes Valley for a little bit. They decided on the Biergarten since they wanted sausage ;)

It was cold, but it wasn't too bad for me since I'm used to SF weather now, but my friend from Socal was FREEZING. The owners or people who worked there found many blankets for them to stay warm. They ended up having two or three blankets to stay warm. 

I ended up getting the pretzel and pork belly sliders. The pretzel was okay. It was cold by the time I got it, so it wasn't amazing. I also didn't get a beer (since I don't really like beer) with it so probably didn't have the full experience with the pretzel I was supposed to. The pork belly sliders, on the other hand, were amazing. The pickles and the sauce that came with the thickly cut belly was so good. 

Overall, great food and good service. 

Protip: blankets to stay warm! Steal them. Also, that pork belly!

excerpts: In terms of food we got the Pork Belly Sliders and Meat Knot (pretzel and pastrami) which were both delicious!
pretzel.author: Kathy L.
pretzel.review:
Beer gardens are down right awesome. If I lived in SF, I'd come here every weekend with friends!

They had a good selection of beer and food. I wanted a light beer so I ordered the Radler (half Lager, half Lemon soda). I really enjoyed it and would get it again! My friend got the Schneider Weisse which was also good. In terms of food we got the Pork Belly Sliders and Meat Knot (pretzel and pastrami) which were both delicious! 

Blankets are also provided for when it gets too chilly. How accommodating is that!

excerpts: So we ordered the curry wurst, pretzel dumplings and the beet salad.
I'm pretty sure we ordered something else as well, but the drunken haze
I was in
makes it hard to remember.
We also got 1 L steins of beer.
pretzel.author: Grant T.
pretzel.review:
After one set of friends left us for the day, we came here with a couple of other friends to continue catching up and trying out places in the city. One friend was meeting up with some other friends here as they were celebrating a birthday. So it was fun to come along.

By the time we ended up here we were hungry. So we decided to order a bit of food. Unfortunately, they seem to run out of the good stuff early (like pretzels? annoying). So we ordered the curry wurst, pretzel dumplings and the beet salad. I'm pretty sure we ordered something else as well, but the drunken haze I was in makes it hard to remember. We also got 1 L steins of beer. Unfortunately, like other German beer places in town, you can't get boots, but it was a nice substitute. 

They do provide blankets for when it gets cold at night, so we huddled up in the warmth of the blankets and drank our beer and ate our food. The food was okay. Nothing super amazing, but fairly standard. The curry wurst definitely didn't hold up to the one I had in Germany, but I wasn't that surprised. The beet salad was nice. 

It's a fun place to hang out and sit outdoors and drink, but it's not incredibly impressive, as ultimately it's just a fenced in area on a bit of cement.

excerpts: Got a pretzel and a bratwurst.
Bratwurst came with curry potatoes, dark mustard and horseradish.
Was excellent with beer.
They also have pretzel knots and deviled eggs.
Probably will try those next time.
Wish they opened a bit earlier and added some heater after sun down!
Taking a star down for that, otherwise this was a definite 5 star!!!
Definitely coming back again!
pretzel.author: Vikram C.
pretzel.review:
Zehr Gut!!!
Excellent place right in the middle of SF with the feel of the original biergartens in Germany! 0.5L & 1L mugs of draft.. (of course, the review is not biased cos of that... ;) :P )
They had 4 different beers on draft ranging from a Helles to a Dopplebock and then a few bottles and also housemade mulled wine. 8$ for the 0.5L and $16 for the 1L mug of helles, obviously I had to get the larger mug. :) 
There's not a lot of seating and its picnic style shared benches. So late in the afternoon, seating wasn't an issue. But it does get busy at times and the line to order food goes out on the street. Also FYI, they did not have propane heaters. So once the sun goes down, be ready to bring on those jackets.
The food options are pretty good. Got a pretzel and a bratwurst. Bratwurst came with curry potatoes, dark mustard and horseradish. Was excellent with beer. They also have pretzel knots and deviled eggs. Probably will try those next time.
Wish they opened a bit earlier and added some heater after sun down! Taking a star down for that, otherwise this was a definite 5 star!!! Definitely coming back again!

excerpts: I also always get a pretzel or two, not only are they nice and warm, but help to soak up all that beer.
One thing about this place is that all the patrons are incredibly friendly.
I don't know if it's the communal seating, but every time I come here
pretzel.author: Thielson D.
pretzel.review:
On an ideal sunny day in SF, this is where I would be. I ALWAYS get the full liter beers so I don't have to get back in line (the lines can get pretty crazy)  to get a second one. I also always get a pretzel or two, not only are they nice and warm, but help to soak up all that beer. One thing about this place is that all the patrons are incredibly friendly. I don't know if it's the communal seating, but every time I come here I end up meeting someone new an have played games with other groups sitting at our table. 

I have never had a beer I didn't like here. I generally stick to the lighter stuff since I'm usually under the sun. Ordering can be a bit overwhelming if you don't know your German beers. The cool thing is they let you sample different beers before you get it and generally give good recommendations if you ask. If you are there later, they give you blankets which I thought was pretty cool. This is undeniably one of my favorite places in SF!

excerpts: A few other items I recommend are the pork belly sliders, the bratwurst platter, pretzel and the gnome burger.
The curry potatoes that accompany the bratwurst are great.
They have good German beer!
Outdoor communal seating allows for socialization amongst other patrons.
I said it once
and I'll say it again, I love Biergarten.
pretzel.author: Kristina S.
pretzel.review: I love Biergarten and so has everyone I've brought here. I also like the concept of reusing old shipping containers and turning them into this beer garden. Every time I'm here I must get the deviled eggs. A few other items I recommend are the pork belly sliders, the bratwurst platter, pretzel and the gnome burger. The curry potatoes that accompany the bratwurst are great. They have good German beer! Outdoor communal seating allows for socialization amongst other patrons. I said it once and I'll say it again, I love Biergarten.

excerpts: In terms of their food - pork sliders are my favorite - the pretzel is also good.
the deviled egg was a bit too salty/sour.
the line to order gets long - if you just want extra food, they have a separate line for limited food menus (cash only) - i usually go to the smitten ice cream after for desert :)
pretzel.author: Miri Kwon R.
pretzel.review:
Great place to hang out on a sunny day/night in SF. 

In terms of their food - pork sliders are my favorite - the pretzel is also good. the deviled egg was a bit too salty/sour. the line to order gets long - if you just want extra food, they have a separate line for limited food menus (cash only) - i usually go to the smitten ice cream after for desert :)

excerpts: The pretzel was pretty good, but not the best German pretzel I've had.
It was a thin style with mustard and horseradish, comes in seeded or non-seeded versions.
pretzel.author: Jennifer W.
pretzel.review:
It seems like we've been waiting a long time for this place. Too bad the opening of this place has been set back time and time again because it's no longer summer. Rainy season is upon us and they will be closed. I love Suppenkuche to begin with so I knew there was no way this couldn't be good.

There's a cash only line for pretzels and pickles. The larger line is for everything, including beer and sausages. Though this line can take a long time, it's not that bad if you get yourself a liter to last yourself a while until the next one. I often find myself going to the bar many times throughout the night at a bar, but here, I can settle down with a large liter stein. The pretzel was pretty good, but not the best German pretzel I've had. It was a thin style with mustard and horseradish, comes in seeded or non-seeded versions. The bratwurst with saurkraut was delicious of course, bursting with clear meaty juice.

There are two restrooms that are very clean and roomy. Sinks are smartly located outside. The drinking area is composed of thin picnic tables and thin benches positioned in a radial fashion around a tree. The tables are really close to each other, so you can literally be trapped in the center with the tree if you exit the wrong way. Otherwise, I love the coziness of good company and warm yellow lights on a nippy evening. This really, is a biergarten.

The huge, glaring drawback is that the line to get into the place at all gets long. I understand that this must be nice once you're inside to not have people crowding around you for seats. But still. It's a funny situation. I felt like I was waiting at the border to go to the promise land and that bouncer was US customs. Either that or it felt like prison, but where being in prison was a good thing. Several other people from the inside were at the chain link fence consoling their friends on the outside. I know how this feels because I was on the outside.

excerpts: Their snack options, especially the German pretzel, are outstanding.
Pricey,
but oh so delicious with that special brown mustard they serve.
pretzel.author: Thankie S.
pretzel.review:
The good ol' beer garden. A novelty in SF (or maybe I'm just living under a rock) but plenty in all of Europe. SHIET this was good. 

Here you'll find some wonderful imported German beer offerings, from your nice and light hefeweizens to the dark lagers. Speak of the dark lagers, my all-time favorite go-t here o is the Köstrizer, a nice dark lager full of chocolate notes and a smooth finish. Think Guiness but more flavorful and not as heavy. 

Yes, the half-liters and liters are pricey, but you're essentially paying for this nice outdoor bar environment. Their snack options, especially the German pretzel, are outstanding. Pricey, but oh so delicious with that special brown mustard they serve. Didn't get to try the pickled deviled eggs, but friends liked it. 

Last, on a really cold San Francisco day (I mean really cold not the stupid usual 65 degrees), the Biergarten staff hand out blankets for all the patrons. Definitely makes you feel like a badass struggling through a Russian winter.

excerpts: pretty darn good!, and an awesomely warm pretzel with mustard and horseradish.
They also have thick wooly blankets!
, unfortunately they close at 9 :(.
Great spot!, will be back.
pretzel.author: Elizabeth T.
pretzel.review: Went on a Wednesday night at 7. It wasn't packed yet fairly full, there were a few tables open. Able to fit 8 where we sat. Had the Steiner Waisser (sp) pretty darn good!, and an awesomely warm pretzel with mustard and horseradish. They also have thick wooly blankets!, unfortunately they close at 9 :(. Great spot!, will be back.

excerpts: They have a great selection of German beers, and their pretzel (comes with mustard and horse radish) is so soft and delicious!
This is a cool place to hang out with friends and grab a beer, or more like 3 (=1 liter).
You could get less than 1 liter, but where's the fun in that?
pretzel.author: Stephanie G.
pretzel.review:
This beer garden is awesome! It's basically a bunch of wooden picnic tables right in the middle of Hayes Valley, enclosed by a fence, so you can people-watch, or people can watch you drink your ginormous 1L beers. 

They have a great selection of German beers, and their pretzel (comes with mustard and horse radish) is so soft and delicious! This is a cool place to hang out with friends and grab a beer, or more like 3 (=1 liter). You could get less than 1 liter, but where's the fun in that? Smitten is also right next to this place so you can grab some ice cream after! 

But GET HERE EARLY, like before-it-opens-early because I guarantee you will wait forever in line. We waited 30 minutes before it opened and there were people in front of us who took all the shaded benches already, which was the reason for my sunburn this weekend.

excerpts: Pretzel rolls and sausages smothered in spicy mustard and kraut area a must.
My favorite thing was the potato dumplings and bacon gravy, it warmed my heart and raised my blood pressure.
This is normally a special that they tend to run out of
pretzel.author: Ryan F.
pretzel.review:
BIergarten was a spot picked out by a friend of mine for a group meet up.  A quirky collection of cargo shipping containers situated in a parking lot in Hayes Valley, I didn't know what to expect. 

Beer 6/10:  I don't must about German beer, but nothing here really blew me away.  Maybe it's just my tastes from the hop filled hills of California but the three German beers that i tried all seemed to taste the same.  The bartender at the end of the night was even able to give us a try of the Octoberfest beer they were going to have on tap the next day as they were switching out the kegs but even that just fell a bit short of expectations.  The bonus of course with German beer is that everything is served in liter glasses. By the time my brain had figured out the conversion rate of liters to pints it was already too late for me. 

Food 8/10:  For such a small location the Biergarten manages to put out a good variety of traditional German beer house food. Pretzel rolls and sausages smothered in spicy mustard and kraut area a must.  My favorite thing was the potato dumplings and bacon gravy, it warmed my heart and raised my blood pressure.  This is normally a special that they tend to run out of so if you get a chance try and snag a plate.

I'll definitely be returning to Bieragarten again just maybe when the weather isn't as cold.  It was great that they offered blankets considering it's an outside venue but i can see this place being huge in the warmer months.

excerpts: Ordered a pretzel with horseradish and mustard.
Eating horse radish feels like an inverted punch to the nose, coming from inside your head, and it really hit me good.
I love horseradish, and the stuff here was like the Falcon punch (super smash bros reference) of horseradish.
pretzel.author: Alex H.
pretzel.review:
Came here on a beautiful SF winter day.  Got a liter of beer with my bro (actual brother), and sat down next to some people. 

Ordered a pretzel with horseradish and mustard.  Eating horse radish feels like an inverted punch to the nose, coming from inside your head, and it really hit me good.  I love horseradish, and the stuff here was like the Falcon punch (super smash bros reference) of horseradish.  The mustard has the kick of a horse too.

They have blankets here for the cold.  Don't fear the long line, it's actually a good thing.  After you finish your first liter, your party can get up, go get some more liters, and find a new crowd to sit around.  It means you get to meet more people and get some different views on the beer garden.  This place is all about socializing.

While we were there, a wedding party decided to roll in and take pictures.  I'm not sure why you'd want to take pictures on your wedding day surrounded by random drunk people, but maybe you're into that kind of thing.  Everyone was clapping for them, but I had no idea who they were.  For all we know it could have been an elaborate street performance.

All in all, Biergarten is a good time.  It supplies you with a rich crowd and a social environment, and big beer to get you nice and saucy (OR BLOATED, but that's just me, right?).

excerpts: Like everything in the city expect a line but, if you have cash you can grab a pretzel or a pickle while you wait.
pretzel.author: Kristen R.
pretzel.review:
Great place to go and enjoy the patio. Like everything in the city expect a line but, if you have cash you can grab a pretzel or a pickle while you wait. Prepare to sit with strangers and have a giant beer. 

The food prices are reasonable and most everything was good. The knot was my fave but, the mustard was intense and dominated the taste of the braut and deviled eggs.

All and all worth the wait it takes.

excerpts: I recommend a liter of Munich Gold ($14) and a cheese knot (like a grilled cheese with shallots on an amazing fresh pretzel roll, $6) Lactose intolerant?
Get the frankfurter on an equally amazing fresh pretzel bun with a sour kraut topper and spicy brown mustard-heaven!
Anything you order will be delicious.
pretzel.author: Talya C.
pretzel.review:
Whether you're a local or just visiting SF, Biergarten is not to be missed! Ideal place for a "sunday funday" boozy lunch or just want feel like it's Octoberfest year round.

FOOD: Who doesn't love pretzels and beer?! If you are a weirdo who doesn't like beer, wine is also available for 6 bucks a cup (literally served in a cup). I recommend a liter of Munich Gold ($14) and a cheese knot (like a grilled cheese with shallots on an amazing fresh pretzel roll, $6) Lactose intolerant? Get the frankfurter on an equally amazing fresh pretzel bun with a sour kraut topper and spicy brown mustard-heaven! Anything you order will be delicious. Even if you are allergic to calories and order a kale salad-still awesome!! 

SETTING: Outdoor wooden benches situated in what looks like a parking lot with a chain link fence around it. Everything is served out of grey boxy bungalows and gives it a very industrial vibe. When the sun goes down and the temp drops, they have blankets available for those unprepared for SF weather. So thoughtful! 

TIPS: Bring money for the meter (they charge on Sundays now) and a deck of cards for fun drinking games if the conversation is lacking. Get there early! By 2pm, the line tends to extend past the gates and seating will be hard to come by as people like to camp out for the afternoon.

excerpts: A "birretta" with a pretzel, enjoying San Francisco's winter sky?
Awesome.
The staff is very nice, but the line might be long and clients might be a little too loud.
But it's overall a pretty good experience!
We definitely need more of these outdoor places in the city!
pretzel.author: Amira T.
pretzel.review:
Awesome! 
I love outdoor eating and drinking.
A "birretta" with a pretzel, enjoying San Francisco's winter sky? Awesome.
The staff is very nice, but the line might be long and clients might be a little too loud. But it's overall a pretty good experience! 
We definitely need more of these outdoor places in the city!

excerpts: Size up because the German beers and pretzel knots are so good!
pretzel.author: B B.
pretzel.review:
I like this spot for the (hopefully) sunny seating, huge liters of beer, and after those are both done, the proximity to drunkenly buy an $80 tee shirt in the shops nearby and feel like you deserve it. Size up because the German beers and pretzel knots are so good! 

The crowd can get a little Vampire Weekend-ish, if you know what I mean, but we always have a fun time eavesdropping on groups of a few dudes picking up on a few ladies. My boyfriend and I have learned some real slick ones, most of which have shockingly been successful. Maybe because they're all wearing sunglasses?

Someone else mentioned patrons are generally friendly here, and while that's mostly true, there have been a couple times after waiting in the very, very long line that some drunker than me fool tried to jump in front of us. Tensions were high, but the situation cooled when he just let us know he was cutting because he "wanted a beer" ....?

The family that runs it is rad too; always friendly.

excerpts: I really wanted a pretzel :( but unfortunately by the time I had reached the front of the line they were out.
Next time!!
pretzel.author: Michelle L.
pretzel.review:
Amazing find tucked away in Hayes Valley. A low key beer garden with good food, beers, and atmosphere for post work shenanigans.

Though this place was crowded on a Friday afternoon, I was able to squeeze myself at the end of one of their tables, liter beer in hand. (Not as exciting as the 2 liter boot I attacked at Leopold's, but definitely reminiscent of pint/liter night in college). 

Their pork belly sliders were pretty memorable, though they are small. I really wanted a pretzel :( but unfortunately by the time I had reached the front of the line they were out. Next time!!

excerpts: Try the pretzel knot with crispy prosciutto!
Oh yeah the beers are amazing too :)
pretzel.author: Carla E.
pretzel.review:
BURGER WEDNESDAY.

Every Wednesday they serve a different burger - check their Instagram for delicious details each week. One of the best burgers in SF. Also Wednesday's are waay better then coming on crowded weekends.
Side note: my bf and I tried 4505's burger one day - We were super unimpressed and left with a burger craving hugely unsatisfied. Immediately headed to Biergarten to fix that.

Actually everything on their food menu is awesome. Try the pretzel knot with crispy prosciutto! 
Oh yeah the beers are amazing too :)

excerpts: Excellent homemade veggie sliders, delicious beet salad and a full of flavor (and sauerkraut) bratwurst on a pretzel roll.
pretzel.author: Jason B.
pretzel.review:
Tell me why.

One reason why Germany's Paul Van Dyk is awesome: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2mCQEM3FugM

Few reasons why German Biergarten is awesome: Excellent homemade veggie sliders, delicious beet salad and a full of flavor (and sauerkraut) bratwurst on a pretzel roll.

Plus homemade pickles and a Weihenstephaner lager so light and easy to drink that there was a bit of regret on this warm(ish) July night for not getting the large size.

Much like a packed PVD show get ready to be close with your neighbors as seating is all at communal tables. Atmosphere is lively but not too loud.

At roughly $25 a person this will not be a cheap excursion. But like a really good DJ experience a really good dining experience shouldn't be either.

Enjoy finding your own reasons for giving four stars.

excerpts: The Bratdog is in a pretzel bun.
Sauerkraut is fresh.
Tasty.
The Andrechser Doppelbock was dark and strong.
Fun.
pretzel.author: Alan K.
pretzel.review: Great environment for beers and brats. The Bratdog is in a pretzel bun. Sauerkraut is fresh. Tasty. The Andrechser Doppelbock was dark and strong. Fun.

excerpts: It is a perfect place to enjoy the afternoon sun with a cold beer and some great bar snacks, like the soft pretzel's, pickles and brats.
pretzel.author: Justin O.
pretzel.review:
As a resident of Hayes Valley, the Biergarten is at the top of my "Go To" List. It is a perfect place to enjoy the afternoon sun with a cold beer and some great bar snacks, like the soft pretzel's, pickles and brats.

The staff is friendly and the location is centrally located right on Octavia in Hayes and is a few steps away form the shopping and other attractions in the area.

The Biergarten is a popular spot, so the line can get pretty long. My advice is order all your beers at once... and if you are contemplating a half v full pint, always go with the big boy. You will thank me when you don't have to get back out of your seat and wait 20 mins in line for a beer.

Overall, I like the experience and day drinking is a SF specialty, so this is a great spot to make it happen.

excerpts: (oh and they said at some point they will be getting a pretzel warmer, yahoo!)
the pretzel came with mustard and horseradish which i'd never had but was TOTALLY delicious!!
and the bacon saurkraut?
FANTASTIC.
mmm.... go here, you won't be disappointed.
pretzel.author: Sara W.
pretzel.review:
This place has GREAT potential, thus 4 stars... I know we went when it was their fourth day open so they've got some kinks to work out. RIDICULOUS lines for entry, beer, and food aside, my only real complaint?  THE BOUNCER...please enjoy my rant.

Saturday 10/22 in SF was absolutely gorgeous, it was in the 80's around 3:30pm when we got in line to get into the Biergarten.  The line wrapped around the block and took us 20-30min before we got to the front for entry.  When only one group was left in front of us, we noticed some random guy just walk up to the front of the line (came from the non-line side of the block,) and start searching his pockets for his wallet.  My bf notices this and actually calls this DB out, "hey man, are you with someone or are you cutting the line??" bewildered man's response, "oh um, i have friends inside..." disgruntled bf: "dude i've got friends inside too and i still waited in this line to get in."  so the guy actually acknowledged this and went to the back of the line...score one.

so now we're at the front of the line, and it happens yet again...some b*tch just walks up and shows the bouncer her ID and the bf calls out this woman too... "hey i just chewed some a**hole out for cutting in front of everyone...you need to wait in like the rest of us."  skank "oh i have friends inside," "WE ALL have friends inside dude!" and the girl must've felt entitled and was like "uh huh" & whipped her hair at this and proceeded inside.  At this point we turn to the bouncer and ask if he's gonna keep letting people in and his lame response was "we just opened a few days ago, we're still figuring stuff out..." really??  i wanted to make the funny/dramatic point that society will start falling apart at the seams if he can't obey the rules of a line.  i mean really dude, DO YOUR JOB.  you're gonna have riots (not really,) and disgruntled patrons...this isn't cool.

upon entry into the biergarten, we weren't 5ft in the door when it happened a third time and this time I was fired up and called them out...and yet again the response they felt justified cutting the line because "we have friends inside." man i guess i should've just done that upon arriving too... i had friends inside too but i still waited! grrr...

ok enough ranting already... after all that hooplah, we still had a wonderful time.  beer line was awful so i can't wait for them to figure that one out.  i still would totally come back, i love the feel of this place.  yay beer n pretzels!  (oh and they said at some point they will be getting a pretzel warmer, yahoo!)  the pretzel came with mustard and horseradish which i'd never had but was TOTALLY delicious!!  and the bacon saurkraut?  FANTASTIC.   mmm.... go here, you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: The sandwich was salami and kraut in between a halved soft pretzel.
This was great as well.
The pretzel was amazingly soft.
We wanted to order just a pretzel, but we were full.
pretzel.author: Leslie P.
pretzel.review:
Afternoon snack/meal brought the three of us here. We ordered the trio of salad, meat sandwich, beef tongue sliders, two pop and a beer. 

The salad consisted of kraut, roasted beets, and potato salads. I'm usually not a fan of potato salad, but this one was delicious! The beet salad was awesome as well and you can't do wrong with kraut. The sandwich was salami and kraut in between a halved soft pretzel. This was great as well. The pretzel was amazingly soft. We wanted to order just a pretzel, but we were full. I didn't try the sliders, but I heard they were scrumptious too!

Overall a great outdoor eatery in Hayes Valley. I loved the environment and atmosphere

excerpts: Food wise, I only had a pretzel.
Overpriced and skipable.
pretzel.author: Seema M.
pretzel.review:
We came here yesterday (Thursday) for happy hour knowing that it had just opened last week and were expecting a crazy line. We strolled up around 6pm and there was no line to get in! Prime HH time and no line? :)

The line for beer was kinda long, but moved quickly. We ordered our steins of authentic hofbrau beer and found a picnic table for six. The crowd was really chill and respectful- no drunken, beer splashing younguns like I had expected. 

Food wise, I only had a pretzel. Overpriced and skipable. I do want to try a bratwurst next time though.

The staff were awesome.. cheerful and always making sure to shoot you a smile if you walked by them.

My brit husband who lived in Germany for a year gives Biergarten his beer loving stamp of approval- that makes it 5 stars alone right there.

excerpts: The pretzel was fresh and perfect as well.
pretzel.author: Ken G.
pretzel.review:
I really liked this spot...it's perfect for Hayes Valley.

On a nice, sunny day, this is the perfect spot for enjoying beer, wine and a small selection of edibles outdoors.  The beer options are great and after sampling a few of them, I really enjoyed everything.  The food was very good too - I had a wurst with sauerkraut, both of which were fresh and fantastic.  The pretzel was fresh and perfect as well.

This place is extremely popular and people will be put off by the long line to get in.  Seating is limited so you just have to expect it.  

The crowd is very cool and chic, but still laid back.  

I can imagine it being an irritating place to be on a cold, overcast or windy day (most days during a summer in San Francisco?), so I'd suggest making sure the temperature is going to be sunny and perfect before going.

excerpts: Love the pretzel, so soft and buttery.
pretzel.author: Vanessa K.
pretzel.review:
How is it possible that this place is packed, full, and the line for beer is almost around the corner at 3:30pm on a Sunday! Also considering they open at 3pm! Waited an hour for a beer, and it's not because the staff was moving slowly.  It appeared that people who were sitting down with their drinks, kept "cutting" and asking their friends who were waiting to get them more beers.  It feels like all the yuppies and hipster wannabe's trek it to hayes valley for the biergarten. Makes the place a little pretentious, and ignoring all of it, it's a great spot.

The beers are delicious and refreshing. Their bratwurst basket is amazing and out of this world. Sauerkraut was done perfectly. Love the pretzel, so soft and buttery.

excerpts: Several good German selections on tap, some decent-looking food options (only had the pretzel, but there were other offerings), and a surprisingly nice ambiance for being made up of converted shipping containers and basic benches on asphalt.
pretzel.author: Thomas R.
pretzel.review:
Great spot for an afternoon beer! Several good German selections on tap, some decent-looking food options (only had the pretzel, but there were other offerings), and a surprisingly nice ambiance for being made up of converted shipping containers and basic benches on asphalt. Friday crowd filled up pretty quickly after the 3pm opening, and the beer line never really got short- recommend an early arrival and ordering the 1L beers to minimize trips.

Hopefully other SF entrepreneurs will take note and create more spots like this- very convivial and fun.

excerpts: The pretzel is served with horseradish and mustard, and the pickles are fresh and crisp.
pretzel.author: Kristin D.
pretzel.review:
Food was amazing, beer is cold and refreshing. Friendly and fast service. Great place to spend an afternoon with friends. 
The cider is crisp and refreshing without being too sweet.
The sausage platter is fantastic.  The pretzel is served with horseradish and mustard, and the pickles are fresh and crisp.

excerpts: The real advantage is having a pretzel, a pickle, or a brat outside on long picnic tables with groups of up to ten to a table.
pretzel.author: Christophe C.
pretzel.review:
Finally been to the Biergarten - it's across the street from me but it took me 10 months to try it! Good thing for half days. And a testament to how popular it is!

Beer selection is okay -- you could always go to suppenkuche for beer without a wait. The real advantage is having a pretzel, a pickle, or a brat outside on long picnic tables with groups of up to ten to a table.

They carded a friend of ours who was over 40. He didn't have his ID because we were doing a company offsite before that required running. They didn't care. Color me ignorant, but that feels like some pretty unempowered employees IMHO. Are we in sf?

Die Bier garten habt real estate but that's it in my opinion. Outside drinking and food and ample space? Go to the falafel place.

excerpts: The snacks hit the spot, perfect drinking snacks like the pretzel, my favorite.
Let the Steigl flow forever, Biergarten.
I love this garden!
pretzel.author: Roland C.
pretzel.review:
There is nothing to not love about Biergarten.  Well, ok.  There is one thing.  Two things, actually.  One:  They could use more taps, especially on days when the weather is great.  Two:  the fact that their lease will be up soon. That will be a sad day when Biergarten closes it's gates for goon. 

Apart from that, Biergarten is perfect.  The beer is awesome and German, with a choice of sizes.  The snacks hit the spot, perfect drinking snacks like the pretzel, my favorite.  Let the Steigl flow forever, Biergarten.  I love this garden!

excerpts: Good beer though and the $4 pretzel I tried was pretty good.
Delicious when warm
but it got so cold that my pretzel didn't take too long to get cold too :(
pretzel.author: An-Nhien L.
pretzel.review:
This is touch because this is a pretty unique establishment and i dig the concept but the line is unreal sometimes! Good beer though and the $4 pretzel I tried was pretty good. Delicious when warm but it got so cold that my pretzel didn't take too long to get cold too :(

+1 for bringing out blankets to everyone when it got colder. That was nice :)

Unfortunately weather is a huge factor in how enjoyable this place will be for me...Unless you have an alcohol blanket on, which can be difficult with the long lines!

excerpts: The pretzel, deviled eggs and cheese knot we ordered were really delicious as well.
Cool spot in a fun neighborhood with good food.
pretzel.author: Daniella O.
pretzel.review: Awesome spot to meet up with friends on a nice sunny afternoon. Beers were delicious, although I'm not usually a fan of dark beers I really liked the Four Point. The pretzel, deviled eggs and cheese knot we ordered were really delicious as well. Cool spot in a fun neighborhood with good food.

excerpts: LPT: get the pretzel.
pretzel.author: Rachel M.
pretzel.review: There is nothing better than sitting outside in the sunshine enjoying a giant beer. On the other hand, there is nothing like wrapping yourself up in one of their blankets and enjoying a giant beer in the cool fog of SF. Either way, Biergarten is a great place to come after a long day. It's relaxing, casual, and always a good time. LPT: get the pretzel.

excerpts:
A Pretzel will go down like a lead balloon after 32 years of neighborhood memories,

regards,
jb.
pretzel.author: Jeromhia B.
pretzel.review:
The Cat and Fiddle in Hollywood was closed for this ?
Good Grief, prepare for a luke warm reception,

Please leave the SF superior sneer complex where it belongs...
A Pretzel will go down like a lead balloon after 32 years of neighborhood memories,

regards,
jb.

excerpts: : one sausage for each of you, a pretzel to share, and for dipping - horseradish (that WILL clear up your nose) and brown mustard.
pretzel.author: Kimya P.
pretzel.review:
Depending on the type of beer you choose a 1/2 liter can be anywhere from $6-8.  Their beer selection is limited in comparison to Suppenkuche but the Schneider weisse hits the spot. 

Bratwurst basket is perfect for two ($18): one sausage for each of you, a pretzel to share, and for dipping - horseradish (that WILL clear up your nose) and brown mustard. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GfeaoeKtZh-57SFWgjPqnw?select=eFrF65UAqKeei47XHGh8oA)

The place is crowded, but as long as you are willing to make friends and share tables, it's great fun especially on a sunny Saturday afternoon.

excerpts: The pretzel and deviled eggs are yum!
pretzel.author: Vanessa H.
pretzel.review: Great beer but a lot of crowding. I would recommend getting there early if you are a large group. The pretzel and deviled eggs are yum!

excerpts: the pretzel, sliders, pickled eggs and veggies were great.
pretzel.author: Clark G.
pretzel.review:
fun time to eat/drink with old friends and make new ones

waited out the line til opening which seems to be the pattern, at least its not the hurry up to wait scene

was able to leverage other half of table to a group of 4 that was kind enough to let us add on to their beer order which is key as the line recycles for rd 2.  like a new D1 recruiting class they move on as a set of friendly ivy educated gals who work private equity sit down and laugh at our dumb jokes.  this city is diverse alright

the pretzel, sliders, pickled eggs and veggies were great.  both dames and dudes restrooms have urinals 

people are friendly (staff / patrons) as its hard to be mean nor grumpy drinkin beer out of giant gustos while baskin in the sun

get your people together and head over

excerpts: We ordered a cheese pretzel to try their handmade pretzels and it was delicious!
If I had room for more food, I would've ordered more just to try everything out.
You can order different sizes for the beer
so don't be scared off by the large giant mugs everyone is carrying around.
pretzel.author: Stephanie H.
pretzel.review:
Be prepared to wait in a very long line ... 

This place is amazing!  And outdoor beer garden is just an awesome place to hang out and drink and have a great time with friends.  We arrived around 3pm and realized that there was already a long line that had formed to get in.  Apparently, you have to go earlier than that to stand in line. 

It took us about 45 minutes to one hour before we got to the front to order and sit down.  There are limited tables and the service can be a little slow.  Not sure why they don't have separate lines for drinks only and drinks/food.  I think that was what was slowing down the line.  Plus, once you get in it might be tough to find a table as most of the tables get filled up quickly.  You might have to squeeze with other people but it makes it more fun. 

We ordered a cheese pretzel to try their handmade pretzels and it was delicious!  If I had room for more food, I would've ordered more just to try everything out.  You can order different sizes for the beer so don't be scared off by the large giant mugs everyone is carrying around.  Or you might be get really excited seeing them.  

Either way this is a really nice place to just sit, enjoy your beer and chat the night away.

excerpts: In summary, there's really nothing better than being with friends under the perfect sunset after a long day of work enjoying an ice cold one and a pretzel.
pretzel.author: Jeremy F.
pretzel.review:
In summary, there's really nothing better than being with friends under the perfect sunset after a long day of work enjoying an ice cold one and a pretzel.

Sorry, minus one star for not wanting to stand in the long line again for a refill on the beer. 
Well, on to the next watering hole...

excerpts: The food is amazing also so don't forget to grab a brat or pretzel!
They have blankets available if you are worried it may be too cold.
An SF must stop for any tourist.
pretzel.author: Casey L.
pretzel.review: One of my favorite places to go in the city for an outdoor beer.  The food is amazing also so don't forget to grab a brat or pretzel!  They have blankets available if you are worried it may be too cold.  An SF must stop for any tourist.

excerpts: I'm a huge fan of the meat and cheese pretzel knots.
pretzel.author: Tysen C.
pretzel.review:
Biergarten is super yummy! The beer is great and served in large quantities and the food is delicious. 

I'm a huge fan of the meat and cheese pretzel knots. Oh and the bratwurst is so good --- the mustard and sauerkraut served with it is fantastic. Also, homemade pickles and pickled carrots and the horseradish...drooling just thinking about it. 

Spend some time outside and enjoy what Beirgarten has to offer. I challenge you to not have a good time :P 

Next stop is the sister restaurant Suppenküche.

excerpts: Tip #1: If your doom is to wait in a line that wraps around the block (and I've been there before), make your time efficient by grabbing some snack foods from the snack stand (like a pretzel
- they're pretty delicious) to make the wait go by faster.
pretzel.author: Linna L.
pretzel.review:
On warm, sunny days (the few that SF sees), you'll find Biergarten packed -- so packed that the line to get beer wraps around the block! But in the end, very few things bring as much joy as a liter of good beer with friends in the sunshine. In my book, all the beers are delightful. The razzler (a lemonade and beer mix) is a bit sweet and doesn't have enough alcohol content for me. Yes, this little girl CAN drink :)

Tip #1: If your doom is to wait in a line that wraps around the block (and I've been there before), make your time efficient by grabbing some snack foods from the snack stand (like a pretzel - they're pretty delicious) to make the wait go by faster. Also, waiting in line with friends is always a plus.

Tip #2: If you see that you have about a third of your liter beer left and you feel a tingling sensation in your bladder, be efficient with your time and drink the rest of your beer while you wait in line for the restroom. Sometimes the line for the restroom exceeds the line for beer!

Tip #3: SF weather is fickle. At 3:00, it may seem all sunshiny and warm, but when 5:30 rolls around, it'll be gray and cold, so be prepared and come with a jacket. If you forget and the beer isn't helping you keep warm, Biergarten staff goes around, handing out blankets! How awesome is that?!?!

Tip #4: Don't skimp on the beer. Order a liter (never the half) . . . you DID just probably wait 15-30 mins for it anyway. Make your suffering worth it.

excerpts: I had a beer and pretzel at the Biergarten -- both of which were good.

pretzel.review:
I came to Biergarten for a quick bite but quickly made friends in the outdoor friendly atmosphere.  I ordered the bratwurst with a tangy sauerkraut and spicy brown mustard on pretzel bread. FYI outside seats only

pretzel.review: Nice place to grab a beer. And try their potatoes and pretzel. FYI outside seats only

pretzel.review:
So much love for this place. It's basically my backyard. The food is fantastic (I prefer the alarmingly pink deviled eggs, and the pretzel-wich with brie and picked shallots), the bathrooms are some of the cleanest I've *ever* seen (tip: they're marked as Mens and Womens in name only so no worries using the other gender's bathroom for efficiency's sake.) Grab a bunch of buddies, get 1L beers, a big pretzel each, and drink your miseries away! Bathroom is pretty fancy porta-potty with a shared sink complete with mirror. Communal picnic benches that you can easily swoop by busting out your eagle eyes. 

P.S. Bring a jacket. Biergarten, can you get some heat lamps up in there?!

pretzel.review: Baby became cranky when they couldn't get into Suppenkuche.  So, they brought baby to the biergarten for brats and beer. Daddy chugged down a lager.  Mommy wolfed down the pretzel.
